p: Vitamin E is a group of lipophilic compounds that includes four tocopherols (α-, β-, γ- and δ-tocopherol) and four tocotrienols (α-, β-, γ- and δ-tocotrienol) [ 76, 77]. The chemical structures of all the compounds referred to as vitamin E have a two-ring 6-hydroxychroman skeleton and a side chain composed of three isoprenoid units. Tocopherols have a chromanol ring and a saturated phytyl tail, while the chemical structures of tocotrienols have an unsaturated tail [ 76, 77, 78] ( Figure 4).
